column2: Fill the canvas with your collage, and show it off to your friends!

First things first - let's get back to the p5.js code editor. You can load your previous sketch (if you saved it at http://editor.p5js.org ), or get back to where we left off: https://editor.p5js.org/madetohack/sketches/okIyaVEw
Last time, you took control of your gif with the mousePressed() and mouseReleased() functions. Now we’re going to fill the canvas!
A collage needs way more than 1 GIF! To add another GIF, first you need to find another GIF on giphy.
Remember, once you find the GIF you like, click Copy Link, and then copy the GIF Link (the middle one) in the popup.
Next, you need to add another line in the preload() function to load the GIF. You can copy the existing line you have, paste in your new GIF’s address, and change the name to gif2.

You also need to duplicate the line inside draw() that says image(... - Replace the name in that line with the new GIF name you just created in preload(). You’ll also need to change the position numbers, otherwise the images will overlap. It’ll take a few tries to get it lined up right!
If you want this new image to react to a mouse click, you need to add it to the mousePressed() and mouseReleased() functions - Just duplicate the line already there and change the name.
After every step, be sure to run and test your code, to make sure you didn’t make any mistakes! Remember, everything has to be spelled and capitalized correctly.
Repeat the whole duplication process a few times, and you’ll fill up your canvas in no time! Then, of course, you can always make it bigger, find even MORE GIFs, and keep adding them!
Now go find someone and show them your P5.JS skills. If they ask how you did it… well, you can say you just hacked it together! See you around!
